com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit

Class CampaignKitManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit.CampaignKitManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProximityKitMonitorNotifier, ProximityKitRangeNotifier, ProximityKitSyncNotifier

    public class CampaignKitManager
extends Object
implements ProximityKitRangeNotifier, ProximityKitSyncNotifier, ProximityKitMonitorNotifier
    This is the primary entry point for the Campaign Kit subsystem.

    A CampaignKitManager instance is the primary interface for working with Campaign Kit cloud data. This provides access to Campaign objects and serves as the central registration point for notifications of related beacon/geofence events.

    For details about the available notifications see the CampaignKitNotifier.

    To initialize a Campaign Kit manager you will need the SDK settings for your kit. These can be found under the kit settings on the Campaign Kit server.

    The easiest way to create a kit Configuration is to build a Map or Properties of the settings (see Configuration for the full list of available settings): 

     Map<String, String> settings = new HashMap<>();
 // or Properties settings = new Properties();
 settings.put(
         Configuration.CONFIG_API_TOKEN,
         "CAMPAIGN KIT API TOKEN HERE"
 );
 settings.put(
         Configuration.CONFIG_API_URL,
         "https://campaignkit.radiusnetworks.com/sdk/v1/kits/YOUR_KIT_ID"
 );
 settings.put(
         Configuration.CONFIG_PK_TOKEN,
         "PROXIMITY KIT API TOKEN HERE"
 );
 settings.put(
         Configuration.CONFIG_PK_URL,
         "https://proximitykit.radiusnetworks.com/api/kits/LINKED_PK_KIT_ID"
 );
 settings.put(
         Configuration.CONFIG_ANALYTICS_URL,
         "CAMPAIGN KIT ANALYTIC URL HERE"
 );
 Configuration kitConfig = new Configuration(settings);

    You can then use the following method to instantiate a singleton CampaignKitManager: 

     public class SampleApp extends Application implements CampaignKitNotifier {
     // Storage for an instance of the manager
     private static volatile CampaignKitManager ckManager = null;

     // Object to use as a thread-safe lock
     private static final Object SHARED_LOCK = new Object();

     @Override
     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();

         // ... kit configuration created per above

         // Standard double check singleton initialization pattern
         if (null == ckManager) {
             synchronized (SHARED_LOCK) {
                 if (null == ckManager) {
                     ckManager = CampaignKitManager.getInstance(
                             getApplicationContext(),
                             kitConfig
                     );
                 }
             }
         }
         ckManager.setNotifier(this);
         ckManager.start();
     }
 }

    To receive callbacks when interesting things happen implement CampaignKitNotifier. And provide that instance to the manager via CampaignKitManager.setNotifier(CampaignKitNotifier).

    WARNING: the current design internally implements the CampaignKitManager as a singleton. Do NOT assume that this will always be the case. As per the example above we strongly recommend that you keep track of your own singleton instance. This way when the behavior does change your app will not be affected. Be aware that calling CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration) more than once will result in a AlreadyInitializedException being thrown.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    CampaignKitNotifier, Campaign, Configuration, Campaign Kit Overview

        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager using the default properties file.

        Not for public use.

        Parameters:
        context - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the properties file cannot be found or loaded.
        InputMismatchException - If there was an error parsing the list of tags.
        MissingKeyException - If properties file does not contain one or more required keys.
        MissingValueException - If properties file contains null or an empty string for a required key value.
        NullPointerException - If context is null.
        NumberFormatException - If the value set for Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL in the properties file cannot be parsed into a long.

      • getInstanceForApplication

        @Deprecated
public static CampaignKitManager getInstanceForApplication(Context context)
        Deprecated. As of 0.6.0, replaced by CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration).
        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager using the default properties file.

        A context must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

        Parameters:
        context - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the properties file cannot be found or loaded.
        InputMismatchException - If there was an error parsing the list of tags.
        MissingKeyException - If properties file does not contain one or more required keys.
        MissingValueException - If properties file contains null or an empty string for a required key value.
        NullPointerException - If context is null.
        NumberFormatException - If the value set for Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL in the properties file cannot be parsed into a long.

      • getInstance

        public static CampaignKitManager getInstance(Context appContext,
                             Configuration config)
        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager.

        Sets up a stopped CampaignKitManager with the provided configuration.

        WARNING: this currently sets a singleton instance for the application. Do NOT assume that this will always be the case. However, since this returns a singleton calling it a 2nd time would result in undefined behavior as either appContext or config could contained different values. As such this currently throws AlreadyInitializedException on subsequent calls. We suggest you implement your own singleton in your application to prevent this exception and ease future upgrades.

        Parameters:
        appContext - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        config - The configuration settings for the manager.
        Returns:
        An instance of CampaignKitManager configured according to config and associated with appContext.
        Throws:
        AlreadyInitializedException - If an instance has already been initialized with a configuration. Thrown on subsequent calls after the first instance if configured successfully.
        NullPointerException - If appContext or config are null.
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • disableGeofences

        public void disableGeofences()
        Explicitly disable geofence support.

        Geofences are disabled by default. The necessary location permissions for geofences are runtime permissions for apps targeting Android 6.0 Marshmallow and newer. If location permissions are revoked after being granted then this should be called to disable geofences.

        Min Android API:
        9 - Google Play services requires this API level.

      • enableGeofences

        public void enableGeofences()
                     throws GooglePlayServicesException
        Explicitly enable geofence support.

        It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the application has properly included and configured the Google Play services library. Additionally, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the device supports Google Play services as well as having been granted appropriate permissions. Failure to ensure these will result in a GooglePlayServicesException.

        Throws:
        GooglePlayServicesException - It is the client's responsibility to ensure that Google Play services is properly listed as a dependency, configured, is granted permission, and available on the device. This exception is thrown under several conditions:
        • Google Play services library is not listed as dependencies by the calling app
        • Google Play services are not properly configured in the calling app
        • The calling app failed to disable geofence when Google Play services were not available on the device
        See Also:
        Setup Google Play services , Checking if Google Play services is available , Google Play Services and Runtime Permissions
        Min Android API:
        9 - Google Play services requires this API level.

      • getFoundCampaigns

        public ArrayList getFoundCampaigns()
        Contains a list of all the campaigns that the app has found. This can be used to populate a ListView with all currently active campaigns that the app has encountered. This will return null prior to syncing.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of campaigns unless exception is thrown, then returns null

      • setCampaignFulfilled

        public boolean setCampaignFulfilled(Campaign campaign,
                           Place place)
        Record a 'fulfilled' analytic event for a campaign.

        Alternatively, fulfilled analytics will be recorded automatically by including "Redemption Places" when setting up the campaign on . After a campaign has been found and viewed, detecting any configured "Redemption Place" will cause this manager to automatically mark the campaign as fulfilled at that place.

        Parameters:
        campaign - the Campaign to mark as "fulfilled"
        place - Place where the campaign was fulfilled. May be null to indicate the campaign was fulfilled but it occurred outside of a configured place or via another process.
        Returns:
        true if campaign was successfully marked as fulfilled; false if the campaign has already been fulfilled or has not been both found and viewed.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if campaign is null

      • setCampaignViewed

        public boolean setCampaignViewed(Campaign campaign)
        Record a 'viewed' analytic event for a campaign.
        Parameters:
        campaign - the Campaign to mark as viewed if it is not already
        Returns:
        true if campaign was successfully marked as viewed; false if the campaign already been viewed or has been found.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if campaign is null

      • setNotifier

        public void setNotifier(CampaignKitNotifier notifier)
        Sets the object that will receive all CampaignKit callbacks.

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(long milliseconds)
        Sets the length of time, in milliseconds, between syncs with the Campaign Kit server.

        This method is provided mainly for ad-hoc debugging purposes. The majority of kit sync use cases are satisfied by setting the interval through the Configuration instead.

        This does not change the value of the manager's base Configuration. Instead it updates the current interval. This will be reset on the next app start.

        Note that syncing does tax battery life as well as consume network bandwidth, so we do not recommend setting this to a low value.

        The minimum value is 300000L ms.

        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Length of time, in milliseconds, between syncs with the Campaign Kit server.
        See Also:
        Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL

      • start

        public void start()
        Syncs data from CampaignKit, and once the sync is done, starts looking for iBeacons matching the beacon regions associated with the active campaigns in Campaign Kit, pre-enabling data callbacks to the CampaignKitNotifier.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop all Campaign Kit activities.

        This will:

        • Stop syncing to the cloud
        • Unregister all known geofences (if enabled)
        • Disconnect from the geofence service (if enabled)
        • Unregister all known beacons
        • Disconnect from the beacon service

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Force a kit sync with the Campaign Kit cloud.

        Usage of this API is discouraged. This method is provided mainly for ad-hoc debugging purposes. The majority of kit sync use cases are satisfied by the normal periodic sync defined by the kit configuration's sync interval.

        See Also:
        Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL
